title: Bosses at Scotland’s top 12 firms ‘paid £55m’
text:
6
Have your say THE SNP is facing calls to tackle executive pay after new figures revealed that the bosses of Scotland’s 12 FTSE-listed firms took home almost £55 million in pay.
Campaigners say it shows that the issue of “fatcat pay” is not restricted to the City of London and needs action north of the border.
David Nish, the outgoing boss of Edinburgh’s pensions giant Standard Life was the highest paid on £5.5 million last year, with his successor Keith Skeoch not far behind on £5.3 million.
